BooksDescription: Saw a YouTube video of Dave Asprey on how gut-based bacteria can help you improve your health & live longer. Thought the premise of the book is interesting, so reading this right now.
Been following Andrew Gazdecki on Twitter for a while and love his consistency in promoting solo founders to keep pushing. Picked up this book to read about his founder's journey.
Saw a lot of reviews on Twitter about this book and the fact that Tony Fadell led teams that created the iPod, iPhone, and Nest Thermostat, was enough of a reason to start reading.
Talks deeply about how we change little things in our daily lives to make time for things that matter to us. The narration was simple, fun, and engaging.

Written by the founders of Basecamp, who're known for building a remote-first company. The narration is simple and well categorized in actionable chapters to move from an in-office setup to a remote-first work culture. A must read for a new age remote work.
Bit-sized marketing strategies that stood the test of time. But, and it's a big BUT, a few of the laws mentioned won't hold in today's age. The book needs revision for sure.
Eric takes you on his journey of building a startup with the philosophy of 'testing your ideas first before betting everything on them'.
Biography of the legendary designer behind Apple products - good account of the life and career of Jony.
Decent one-time read about the history of Google. Only read if you’re interested in the Why, How, & What of Google.

The book that changed my life in how I see work & its relationship with my life. Read this book during my college days and it shaped me to care about work-life balance from day 1 of my career. A must-read if you care about taking back a few hours from your workday and giving it to something that you care about (cycling, resting, meeting family, etc.)

A worth read for everyone out there who thinks they’re incapable of talking and attracting love in love, temporary or permanent. The author talks about an underground community of pickup artists who rely on some psychological tactics to overcome their fear of talking & charming people.

BooksName: The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
BooksDescription: Decent fiction with some meaningful tips for leading a contentful life. Might be too religious in getting people to seek spirituality.

Loved the writing style of Paulo in this book. Very simple storytelling - talking about a boy from Andalsuia and his adventures through African desert to find treasure in Pyramids of Egypt. Definitely in my re-read lists in fiction category.

BooksName: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
BooksDescription: A timeless book that talks about 7 habits that has helped leaders around the world in conquering their problems. The book has lots of stories and frameworks embedded so might feel a bit slow, but worth reading through.
